title: Add NBA standings display to admin grading panel with dark mode support and deep linking
Fix mobile standings view first user row visibility
description:
Fixing mobile standings view sticky positioning - REVISED APPROACH

Initial attempts failed - reverting to closer-to-original approach.

ROOT CAUSE ANALYSIS:
The original code had sticky positioning for BOTH the team header row AND the first user row to keep both visible during scrolling. My attempt to disable first-row stickiness caused it to be hidden.

CORRECT SOLUTION:
Restore the sticky positioning for the first user row BUT increase its z-index to ensure it appears ABOVE the team header row instead of being covered by it.

Z-INDEX LAYERING (top to bottom):
1. First user row cells: z-40 (highest - appears above everything)
2. Conference header div: z-20
3. Team header User/Pts cells: z-20 (horizontal stickiness)
4. Team header thead: z-10 (vertical stickiness)
5. Other user rows: z-10

POSITIONING:
- Conference header: sticky top-0
- Team header: sticky with top = conferenceHeaderHeight  
- First user row: sticky with top = conferenceHeaderHeight + teamHeaderHeight

CHANGES IN LeaderboardDetailPage.jsx:
- Lines 1223, 1321: Restored hasStickyPosition = mobileFirstRowStickyTop > 0 (was false)
- Lines 1228, 1326: Increased first row z-index from z-20 to z-40 (was z-30 originally, tried z-20, now z-40)
- Lines 1227, 1325: stickyCellStyle gets mobileFirstRowStickyStyle when hasStickyPosition is true

This ensures:
- Conference header visible at top
- Team header row visible and sticky below conference header
- First user row visible and sticky below team header (with higher z-index to prevent overlap)
- All other user rows scroll normally

title: Fix mobile standings view first user row visibility
description:
Fixed mobile standings view sticky positioning issue - corrected approach.

Root cause: First user row had sticky positioning that caused it to overlap with team header row.

Final solution:
1. Conference header div: sticky top-0 z-20 (stays at viewport top)
2. Team header (thead): sticky z-10 with style={{top: conferenceHeaderHeight}} (sticks below conference header)
3. User/Pts th cells: sticky left-0/left-[80px] z-20 (horizontal stickiness only for scrolling)
4. Team logo th cells: no sticky (inherit vertical stickiness from thead parent)
5. First user row: hasStickyPosition = false (disabled vertical stickiness to prevent overlap)
6. First user row z-index: reduced from z-30 to z-20

Changes in LeaderboardDetailPage.jsx:
- Lines 1188, 1287: Added sticky z-10 and style={mobileHeaderStickyStyle} back to thead
- Lines 1190-1191, 1289-1290: Removed style={mobileHeaderStickyStyle} from User/Pts th cells (only keep left stickiness)
- Lines 1193, 1292: Removed sticky class from team logo th cells
- Lines 1221, 1319: Set hasStickyPosition = false for first user row
- Lines 1228, 1326: Reduced first row z-index from z-30 to z-20

This ensures proper layering:
- Conference header visible at top
- Team header row visible below conference header  
- User rows scroll normally without overlap
- Horizontal scrolling keeps User/Pts columns visible
